purpleculture_pinyin:
huá
to cut; to slash; to scratch (cut into the surface of sth); to strike (a match)
резать; рубить; царапать (врезать в поверхность что-то); чиркнуть (спичкой)

huà
to delimit; to transfer; to assign; to plan; to draw (a line); stroke of a Chinese character
разграничивать; перевести; назначить; планировать; рисовать (линия); штрих китайского иероглифа
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 划)
Pictophonetic: 畫 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
划算 [ huá suàn ]: to calculate; to weigh (pros and cons); to view as profitable; worthwhile; value for money; cost-effective
划艇 [ huá tǐng ]: rowing boat; racing row-boat
划拉 [ huá la ]: to sweep; to brush away
划子 [ huá zi ]: small row-boat
劃分 [ huà fēn ]: to divide up; to partition; to differentiate
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 畫 [ huà ] picture, painting, drawing; to draw
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
heisig_chinese_memo: Drawing a realistic looking sword is harder than it sounds.  I scratched my head for a while before I figured out how.
Ru_trainchinese:
huà: (сущ/глаг) черта; рисовать, чертить (одинак. с 画)
huá: (глаг) царапать
huà: (глаг) разграничить; провести черту
Kanshudo_mnemonic: drawing (畫) a sword (刂) is still a kind of drawing
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Drawing a realistic looking sword is harder than it sounds.  I scratched my head for a while before I figured out how.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " knife ", from " painting ", " painting " also sounds, the original meaning is to cut things apart with sharp objects. "Shuowen": "Cone knife says to draw. From the knife to the painting, the painting also sounds." Duan Yucai's note: "Cone knife to draw is to draw. There are no characters in the picture, but this is supplemented. The plan is also." Tang Meng Haoran's "Tour of Tiantai Mountain": "Thousands of valleys belong to the Han, and the thousand peaks are divided into the other."

" Stroke " can mean division. "The Family Instructions of the Yan Clan: Homecoming" by the Northern Qi Yan: "Kyushu has not been classified, and the nations have not been divided."
humanum_short_description_en: From " knife ", from " painting ", " painting " also sounds, the original meaning is to cut things apart with sharp objects.
humanum_full_description:
從「刀」，從「畫」，「畫」亦聲，本義為用尖利物將東西割開。《說文》：「錐刀曰劃。从刀从畫，畫亦聲。」段玉裁注：「錐刀畫曰劃。畫字各本無，今補，謂錐刀之末所畫謂之劃也。」唐孟浩然〈遊天台山記〉：「萬壑歸於漢，千峰劃彼蒼。」

　　「劃」可表示劃分。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧歸心》：「九州未劃，列國未分。」
humanum_short_description: 從「刀」，從「畫」，「畫」亦聲，本義為用尖利物將東西割開。

  • ⿰ Left to right

    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
  • Pinyin: huá

    English Definition: to cut; to slash; to scratch (cut into the surface of sth); to strike (a match)
    Example Words:
    划算 [ huá suàn ]: to calculate; to weigh (pros and cons); to view as profitable; worthwhile; value for money; cost-effective
    划艇 [ huá tǐng ]: rowing boat; racing row-boat
    划拉 [ huá la ]: to sweep; to brush away
    划子 [ huá zi ]: small row-boat
    More: 劃* | *劃 | *劃*

    English Definition: to delimit; to transfer; to assign; to plan; to draw (a line); stroke of a Chinese character
    Example Words:
    劃分 [ huà fēn ]: to divide up; to partition; to differentiate

HSK 5: 劃,划
(Simplified: 划)
Pictophonetic: 畫 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 畫 [ huà ] picture, painting, drawing; to draw
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
①用槳撥水使船行動：划水。划船。划艇。
②合算，按利益情況計較是否相宜：划算。
③用刀或其它東西把物件分開或從物件上面擦過：劃一道口子。
划算 [ huá suàn ]: to calculate; to weigh (pros and cons); to view as profitable; worthwhile; value for money; cost-effective
划艇 [ huá tǐng ]: rowing boat; racing row-boat
划拉 [ huá la ]: to sweep; to brush away
划子 [ huá zi ]: small row-boat
①分開：劃界。劃分。劃時代意義。
②設計：計劃。籌劃。策劃。出謀劃策。
劃分 [ huà fēn ]: to divide up; to partition; to differentiate

從「 刀 」，從「 畫 」，「 畫 」亦聲，本義為用尖利物將東西割開。《說文》：「錐刀曰劃。从刀从畫，畫亦聲。」段玉裁注：「錐刀畫曰劃。畫字各本無，今補，謂錐刀之末所畫謂之劃也。」唐孟浩然〈遊天台山記〉：「萬壑歸於漢，千峰劃彼蒼。」 「 劃 」可表示劃分。北齊顏之推《顏氏家訓‧歸心》：「九州未劃，列國未分。」
From " knife", from " painting", " painting" also sounds, the original meaning is to cut things apart with sharp objects. "Shuowen": "Cone knife says to draw. From the knife to the painting, the painting also sounds." Duan Yucai's note: "Cone knife to draw is to draw. There are no characters in the picture, but this is supplemented. The plan is also." Tang Meng Haoran's "Tour of Tiantai Mountain": "Thousands of valleys belong to the Han, and the thousand peaks are divided into the other." " Stroke" can mean division. "The Family Instructions of the Yan Clan: Homecoming" by the Northern Qi Yan: "Kyushu has not been classified, and the nations have not been divided."

劃字的基本解释

劃
huá

劃
huà
均见“划”。

劃字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huà］
［《廣韻》胡麥切，入麥，匣。］
［《廣韻》呼麥切，入麥，曉。］
“划2”的繁体字。
(1)划分。
(2)筹谋。
(3)把款项或账目从某一单位或户头转到另一单位或户头。
(4)忽然。
(5)象声词。参见“劃然”。
(6)同“畫”。汉字的一笔叫一划。
[②]［huá］
“划4”的繁体字。
(1)开，开辟。
(2)割。
(3)摩擦；抹拭。
[③]［huai˙］
“划3”的繁体字。

劃字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　劃； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页144第10
〔古文〕?【唐韻】呼麥切【集韻】【韻會】忽麥切【正韻】霍虢切，?轟入聲。【說文】錐刀也。又【廣韻】劃，作事也。又【玉篇】以刀劃破物也。又【唐韻】【集韻】?胡麥切，音獲。裂也。【集韻】或作劐。亦作?。

劃字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
劃字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［huà］
["Guangyun" Hu Maiqie, enter the wheat, box. ]
["Guangyun" Call Maiqie, enter Mai, Xiao. ]
The traditional characters of "設2".
(1) Division.
(2) Planning.
(3) Transfer money or accounts from one unit or account to another unit or account.
(4) Suddenly.
(5) Onomatopoeia. See "planned."
(6) Same as "painting". One stroke of a Chinese character is called a stroke.
[②]［huá］
The traditional characters of "觀4".
(1) Open up, open up.
(2) Cut.
(3) Friction; wipe.
[③]［huai˙］
Traditional Chinese characters for "觀3".
